Releases have a DOI, e.g. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1400175
release_notes_vulns_justification: no publicly known vulnerabilities till now
report_responses_justification: average mailing list response time O(hours), Tracking of new issues in fortnightly open developer video conferences: https://github.com/nest/nest-simulator/wiki/Open-NEST-Developer-Video-Conference
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: vulnerabilities are to be reported via GitHib security advisories as described in the policy https://github.com/nest/nest-simulator/security/policy
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: GitHib security advisories are private to the core developers and published once resolved or when categorized as non-critical.   https://github.com/nest/nest-simulator/security/policy
build_floss_tools_justification: GCC, cmake/make, python, cython, cppcheck, vera++, ...
test_most_justification: tests are run by continuous integration framework
test_policy_justification:
Review guidelines state that "New features [...] need to be accompanied by one or more tests"
http://nest.github.io/nest-simulator/code_review_guidelines
tests_documented_added_justification:
Review guidelines state that "New features [...] need to be accompanied by one or more tests"
http://nest.github.io/nest-simulator/code_review_guidelines
warnings_justification: code quality is checked by cppcheck, vera++ for C++ parts and PEP8 for Python
warnings_fixed_justification: warnings of the code quality checks cause CI to fail the build.
delivery_unsigned_justification: DOI is fixed to a specific MD5 sum available over HTTPS: https://zenodo.org/record/1400175#.W6kCthh9gUE
static_analysis_often_justification: analysis is run by CI: https://travis-ci.org/nest/nest-simulator
dynamic_analysis_justification: analysis is run by CI: https://travis-ci.org/nest/nest-simulator
discussion_justification:
GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
Mailinglist has a public archive at https://nest-simulator.org/mailinglist.
Open developer video conferences are held every other week, minutes are given in GitHub wiki https://github.com/nest/nest-simulator/wiki/Open-NEST-Developer-Video-Conference

name: Godot Engine
description: Godot is an advanced, feature-packed, multi-platform 2D and 3D open source game engine.
sites_https_justification: All URLs given on this page use HTTPS.
contribution_justification: Contribution file in repository: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: License file in repository: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/LICENSE.txt
floss_license_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Hosted on Read the Docs, see https://docs.godotengine.org/
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository is hosted on GitHub, which uses Git. (Git is distributed.) Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_semver_justification: Godot being a "creative" application (like Blender), it's difficult to enforce strict semantic versioning. Patch releases are usually fully backwards-compatible, but this is not guaranteed either.
version_tags_justification: Stable versions are tagged (but not pre-releases like alphas and betas).
release_notes_vulns_justification: Check the Security section of the changelog at https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md.
test_justification: The doctest unit testing framework is used: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/tree/master/tests
test_invocation_justification: Build with `tests=yes` SCons flag and run the Godot binary with the `--test` command line argument.
test_most_justification: Achieving a high percentage of test coverage in such a large codebase is very difficult and time-consuming.
test_policy_justification:
Unit tests for new features are recommended but not required: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#write-unit-tests
However, not everything can be reliably unit-tested. For instance, rendering and physics are difficult to test in an automated manner as they aren't deterministic.
tests_are_added_justification: Not everything can be unit tested reliably (like rendering or physics). This makes it difficult to add tests for all large features.
tests_documented_added_justification: Unit tests for new features are recommended but not required: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#write-unit-tests
warnings_justification: Compiler warnings are turned into errors on CI. Some platform-specific warnings may remain, and are fixed on a best-effort basis.
warnings_fixed_justification: Compiler warnings are turned into errors on CI. Some platform-specific warnings may remain, and are fixed on a best-effort basis.
warnings_strict_justification: Compiler warnings are turned into errors on CI. Some platform-specific warnings may remain, and are fixed on a best-effort basis.
crypto_working_justification: MD5 is only used for non-security critical uses, such as checking whether files have been modified before reimporting assets in the editor.
delivery_mitm_justification: Godot releases can be downloaded through HTTPS. Official Windows editor binaries are signed, but binaries for other platforms aren't.
delivery_unsigned_justification: The editor asset library integration (which performs SHA-256 hash verification) only uses HTTPS.
static_analysis_justification: Contributors run various Clang analyzers and open pull requests on a regular basis.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: The Clang sanitizers are regularly run by contributors. LGTM analysis is also configured on the main Godot repository.
static_analysis_often_justification: As of writing, cppcheck is manually run by contributors in an occasional basis.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: Godot doesn't use weak ciphers or MD5/SHA1 in places where security is important.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardening_justification: Godot is a game engine. Hardening mechanisms can sometimes be adverse to performance or convenience, making them difficult to implement in this context.
crypto_used_network_justification: TLS 1.2 is supported by the HTTPClient and HTTPRequest classes.
crypto_tls12_justification: TLS 1.2 is supported by the HTTPClient and HTTPRequest classes.
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: HTTPClient, HTTPRequest and StreamPeerSSL verify certificates by default.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: Godot is compiled as a single binary which can easily be moved and run anywhere on the system.
build_reproducible_justification: Official binaries aren't reproducible, but self-compiled binaries can be reproducible.
dco_justification: As of writing, Godot doesn't use a DCO.
code_of_conduct_justification: Godot Engine code of conduct: https://godotengine.org/code-of-conduct
bus_factor_justification: As of writing, Godot has about 40 "core developers" with significant activity: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/graphs/contributors
documentation_achievements_justification: Will be added to https://github.com/godotengine/godot if the badge is obtained.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: The Godot editor and projects exported with Godot don't support screen readers yet.
sites_password_security_justification: bcrypt is used on the Godot asset library.
maintenance_or_update_justification: 3.2.x is still maintained while Godot 4.0 is being developed.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: clang-format is used for C++/C/Objective-C/Java and black is used for Python.
build_standard_variables_justification: The SCons setup obeys those variables.
build_preserve_debug_justification: If `target=debug` (the default) or `target=release_debug` is used, debugging symbols will be present in the final binary.
build_non_recursive_justification: Godot is built with a single SCons call (all dependnecies are included in-tree).
build_repeatable_justification: Godot's SCons setup supports reproducible builds.
installation_standard_variables_justific: As of writing, Godot's SCons setup doesn't have an `install` step.
installation_development_quick_justifica: A script to install dependencies is being worked on: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/43377
external_dependencies_justification: A script to install dependencies is being worked on: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/43377
dependency_monitoring_justification: Third-party dependencies are regularly updated by contributors: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/thirdparty/README.md
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Third-party dependencies are regularly updated by contributors: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/thirdparty/README.md
interfaces_current_justification: Godot doesn't use any deprecated APIs.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: The doctest C++ framework is used in Godot and is run on CI.
regression_tests_added50_justification: Not everything can be reliably unit-tested in Godot (especially physics or rendering).
test_statement_coverage80_justification: Not everything can be reliably unit-tested in Godot (especially physics or rendering).
test_policy_mandated_justification: Unit tests for new features are recommended but not required: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#write-unit-tests
implement_secure_design_justification: Godot is a game engine and does the best possible decisions out of the box, but it can't prevent a game developer from making an insecure project.
input_validation_justification: Godot performs validation before opening scenes or resources and will bail out if the data is invalid.
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: Godot is a game engine. Supporting multiple algorithms for encryption is generally not necessary.
crypto_credential_agility_justification: Android keystore credentials can't be stored outside of `export_presets.cfg` yet.
contributors_unassociated_justification: As of writing, Godot has about 40 "core developers" with significant activity: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/graphs/contributors
copyright_per_file_justification: All C++/C/Java/Objective-C source files contain a license header.
license_per_file_justification: All C++/C/Java/Objective-C source files contain a license header.
require_2FA_justification: 2FA is encouraged but not required for project contributors.
secure_2FA_justification: 2FA is encouraged but not required for project contributors. For GitHub, using TOTP is recommended over SMS-based authentication.
two_person_review_justification: At least 1 review from a core committer is required before a pull request can be merged.
test_statement_coverage90_justification: Not everything can be reliably unit-tested in a game engine like Godot (especially rendering and physics).
test_branch_coverage80_justification: Not everything can be reliably unit-tested in a game engine like Godot (especially rendering and physics).

name: ceph
description:
Ceph is an object storage based free software storage platform that stores data on a single distributed computer cluster, and provides interfaces for object-, block- and file-level storage. Ceph aims primarily to be completely distributed without a single point of failure, scalable to the exabyte level, and freely available.

Ceph replicates data and makes it fault-tolerant, using commodity hardware and requiring no specific hardware support. As a result of its design, the system is both self-healing and self-managing, aiming to minimize administration time and other costs.

name: Zowe - OpenSource for z/OS
description:
Zowe is a collection of technologies that make embracing the mainframe (z/OS) in a familiar way for those not familiar with it.  The technologies include REST APIs to enable CI/CD and system administration, a command-line interface that runs on the desktop (Mac, Linux, Windows) and a Desktop View that renders the mainframe in a familiar Desktop motif.

In addition to the core technologies, the project includes a variety of applications like TN3270, Z explorers for accessing files, submitting and retrieving job output as well as a communication framework to enable inter application communication.
description_good_justification:
Zowe offers modern interfaces to interact with z/OS and allows you to work with z/OS in a way that is similar to what you experience on cloud platforms today. You can use these interfaces as delivered or through plug-ins and extensions that are created by clients or third-party vendors.

Zowe consists of the following main components.

zLUX: Contains a Web user interface (UI) that provides a full screen interactive experience. The Web UI includes many interactions that exist in 3270 terminals and web interfaces such as IBM z/OSMF.

Explorer server: Provides a range of APIs for the management of jobs, data sets, z/OS UNIX System Services files, and persistent data.

API Mediation Layer: Provides an API abstraction layer through which APIs can be discovered, catalogued, and presented uniformly.

Zowe CLI: Provides a command-line interface that lets you interact with the mainframe remotely and use common tools such as Integrated Development Environments (IDEs), shell commands, bash scripts, and build tools for mainframe development. It provides a set of utilities and services for application developers that want to become efficient in supporting and building z/OS applications quickly.https://zowe.org
contribution_justification: https://zowe.org/code-guidelines-4/
license_location_justification:
https://github.com/zowe/imperative/blob/master/LICENSE
https://github.com/zowe/zlux-platform/blob/master/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: All software in the Zowe organization is licensed under the Eclipse Public License 2.0
floss_license_osi_justification: https://zowe.org/contribute/
documentation_basics_justification: https://zowe.github.io/docs-site/
repo_public_justification: https://github.com/zowe
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: https://github.com/zowe/ Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: The project uses v.r.m format for Version Release and Modification number.
report_archive_justification:
https://github.com/zowe/zlc/issues

The project uses GitHub Issues for all repositories in the project.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: No submitted vulnerability reports yet. Some known vulnerabilities are being addressed as normal development on the path to 1.0.0 release, so this response time criteria should begin after 1.0.0.
build_common_tools_justification: NPM, Gradle, and Jenkins Pipelines are our primary build tooling.
build_floss_tools_justification: Some limited portions of the application require a C Compiler on the Mainframe, which by nature of the environment will not be FLOSS. The majority of the components within Zowe are buildable using FLOSS tools.
test_most_justification: Code coverage % and branch coverage % vary across projects, is tracked individually, and will be worked down by the teams over time.
warnings_justification: TSLint, ESLint, and Checkstyle (Java) in use across all projects.
warnings_strict_justification: We generally extend other well known open source linting rules (such as airbnb-eslint), and do not disable problematic rules in bulk.
crypto_keylength_justification: We use 2048 RSA keys. No other hashing or key storage.
crypto_random_justification: No keys generated using random input.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: SonarQube has a common vulnerability / bug analysis module.
static_analysis_often_justification: Every commit for most subprojects, daily is the slowest cadence.
dynamic_analysis_justification: This is unmet for 1.0.0, but will be reviewed post 1.0.0. Reaching 80% branch coverage is likely a preferred solution.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: There is - as of December 20 - no C code in Zowe. There may be some added mid January; will review this criterion at that time.
discussion_justification:
https://zowe.org/contribute/

We use Slack, e-mailing lists, Git Issues and Waffle.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

description: Real-time performance and health web monitoring, for Linux, FreeBSD and MacOS.
description_good_justification:
README.md on https://github.com/netdata/netdata
web page https://my-netdata.io
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
contribution_requirements_justification: <https://github.com/netdata/netdata/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributions-ground-rules> contains the markdown version, <https://docs.netdata.cloud/contributing/#contributions-ground-rules> contains the generated HTML version
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/netdata/netdata/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: All documentation is on github wiki: https://github.com/netdata/netdata/wiki
documentation_interface_justification: We provide a swagger description of the API: https://github.com/netdata/netdata/wiki/REST-API-v1
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: All interim versions are maintained in the same public github repo.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification:
The release process is automated and uses semantic versioning.
For rolling releases we use github commit IDs.
version_tags_justification: Yes, this is automated. Each release is tagged at the master branch.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/netdata/netdata/blob/master/ChangeLog>.
release_notes_vulns_justification: We don't have any publicly known vulnerabilities yet.
report_responses_justification: We apply github issue labels (bug) to github issues: https://github.com/netdata/netdata/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3Abug
enhancement_responses_justification: We reply to all requests within a few days.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: <https://github.com/netdata/netdata/security/policy#reporting-a-vulnerability> contains a link to post a vulnerability report at <https://groups.google.com/a/netdata.cloud/forum/#!newtopic/security>. The posts are not public.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: All vulnerability reports we have received so far, have been addressed within a 1-2 days.
build_justification: In the project repo there is an installer that does everything to build and install the package: https://github.com/netdata/netdata/blob/master/netdata-installer.sh
test_justification: The netdata daemon has embedded unit testing for its core functionality (data collection, database operations and interpolation).
test_invocation_justification: The binary netdata produced by compiling the code, can run its unit tests by itself. It is a command line parameter.
warnings_justification:
Under development we always compile with (for gcc):

CFLAGS="-O1 -ggdb -Wall -Wextra -Wformat-signedness -fstack-protector-all -DNETDATA_INTERNAL_CHECKS=1 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -DNETDATA_VERIFY_LOCKS=1"
warnings_fixed_justification: Compiling the code does not produce any warning.
warnings_strict_justification:
Under development we always compile with (for gcc):

CFLAGS="-O1 -ggdb -Wall -Wextra -Wformat-signedness -fstack-protector-all -DNETDATA_INTERNAL_CHECKS=1 -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -DNETDATA_VERIFY_LOCKS=1"
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: We don't have any known vulnerabilities unpatched.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: We fix all vulnerabilities immediately (1-2 days) after they are identified.
static_analysis_justification:
We use several tools and online services:

FOSS tools:

- shellcheck
- pylint
- csslint
- jslint
- cppcheck

Online Services:

- LGTM.com at https://lgtm.com/projects/g/firehol/netdata/
- CodeClimate.com at https://codeclimate.com/github/firehol/netdata
- Codacy at https://app.codacy.com/project/netdata/netdata/dashboard
- Coverity Scan at https://scan.coverity.com/projects/firehol-netdata
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j:
Several of the tools and static code analysis tools we use perform security analysis.

For example:
- Codacy has a security audit: https://app.codacy.com/app/netdata/netdata/security
- LGTM.com does several security checks (like XSS)
static_analysis_fixed_justification: All security issues identified are fixed usually within 1-2 days.
static_analysis_often_justification:
Everything is automated via github and travis.
The only exception is Coverity Scan, which we use on demand and prior to each release.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We regularly use valgrind and we enforce its use before a release.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: The programs runs controlled assertions to exit cleanly on such errors, in the form of a fatal() call.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: All security issues identified are fixed usually within 1-2 days.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We run the implemented unit tests automatically via travis-CI.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: Everything in netdata, including PRs and issues are in English.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
implementation_languages: C, Python, JavaScript, Shell, M4, Makefile, CMake, POV-Ray SDL, C++, Objective-C, Dockerfile
